net.frozencode.jniolib.server

Class JNioBindingParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.frozencode.jniolib.server.JNioBindingParameters

  • public final class JNioBindingParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    The JNioBindingParameters class stores information needed by the JNioServer class to begin handling connections.
    Author:
    James Smith

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
      Stores the default size of read/write buffers if one is not specified.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JNioBindingParameters(JNioEventListener listener)
      Constructs a new JNioBindingParameters object specifying that events should be sent to a particular JNioEventListener.

    • Method Summary

      Indicates that a specified number of bytes should be reserved when reading from or writing to a client.

      Indicates that connections should use a specified SSLContext to encrypt communications.

      Indicates that connections should use a specified SSLContext with the specified SSLParameters to encrypt communications.
      void setTimeout(long millis)
      Indicates that connections which have not received data for a specified number of milliseconds should be disconnected.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
        Stores the default size of read/write buffers if one is not specified.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • JNioBindingParameters

        public JNioBindingParameters(JNioEventListener listener)
        Constructs a new JNioBindingParameters object specifying that events should be sent to a particular JNioEventListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the JNioEventListener which events should be sent to. Non-NULL.

    • Method Detail

      • setSSLContext

        public void setSSLContext(javax.net.ssl.SSLContext context)
        Indicates that connections should use a specified SSLContext to encrypt communications. If NULL is provided, communications will not be encrypted. This method is equivalent to setSSLContext(context, null). Default value: null.
        Parameters:
        context - the SSLContext to use to encrypt communications. NULL-OK.

      • setSSLContext

        public void setSSLContext(javax.net.ssl.SSLContext context,
                          javax.net.ssl.SSLParameters params)
        Indicates that connections should use a specified SSLContext with the specified SSLParameters to encrypt communications. If the SSLContext is NULL, the SSLParameters will not be used and communications will not be encrypted. Default value: null, null.
        Parameters:
        context - the SSLContext to use to encrypt communications. NULL-OK.
        params - additional parameters for the provided SSLContext. NULL-OK.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(long millis)
        Indicates that connections which have not received data for a specified number of milliseconds should be disconnected. If 0 is specified, connections will never be disconnected due to a lack of received data. Default value: 0.
        Parameters:
        millis - the number of milliseconds to allow connections to be idle. Must be non-negative.

      • setBufferSize

        public void setBufferSize(int bufSize)
        Indicates that a specified number of bytes should be reserved when reading from or writing to a client. This value must be AT LEAST a large as the largest packet which is expected to be sent or received, and it is recommended that it be AT LEAST twice as large as that. Default value: DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE.
        Parameters:
        bufSize - the number of bytes to reserve for reading/writing to/from a client. Must be > 0.
